channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cars driving over grass and pavement, 22nd December
item.description:
Not sure whether this has happened at the same time but vans and cars have driven over grass and have a damaged wall outside of house. Please can we request a post to be placed on grass or tree planted to stop drivers driving over public footpath as it is a danger to pedestrians. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight out, 22nd December

item.title: Mechanics set up again between hawksmoor close and plumstead health centre, 22nd December
item.description:
This a recurring problem where mechanics set up and work on multiple vehicles between hawksmoor and plumstead health centre causing issues for visitors parking, loud noise and obstruction for visitors. businesses should not be setting up here. This is manual dirty work and restricting visitors accessing Plumstead health Centre. Also just witnesses a black male throwing rubbish next to the large bush in the hedge row next to the big bush near the external of the fence of a resident of hawksmoor. It is not safe for visitors to Plumstead Health Centre to operate such a business from here.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hawksmoor Close, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves and moss on pathway, 22nd December
item.description:
The path is heavily littered with leaves that are slippery following heavy rainfall. Also a lot of moss on pathway which is a slip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hornbeam Way, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food waste in recycling bags, 22nd December
item.description:
25 Martaban Road residents continue to litter the pavement by posting recycling bags that contain food waste onto the pavement. Foxes or crows are ripping the bags open and spilling the food waste. Also, black rubbish bags are still left on the pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Martaban Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in Princess Road NW6 at junction with Cambridge Gardens, 22nd December
item.description:
Flytipping shown in images has been here for some considerable time. Ignored by Brent's Patrols on bikes with bodywork cameras who were just here. CCTV camera in Cambridge Gardens is pointing to this location so Brent should be able to check when this took place and by whom.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet
